link-text: Evopropinquitous: Things I Learned as a Field Biologist #639
link-description:
evopropinquitous:

It is generally unwise to get your feet wet when doing field work. Yes, thereâs a certain amount of squishy discomfort when your wool socks are squelching in your rubber boots, with the wet fabric gently but persistently scraping against the now-doughy, damp, cold flesh of your feet. And if you…

Some days I am so happy about my life choices.
